create_sample
Class TopicClassifier

java.lang.Object
  create_sample.TopicClassifier

public class TopicClassifier
extends java.lang.Object

Uses a language model classifier to classify a tweet's topic from a list of 18 news topics. The possible topics are:

  • Business_Finance
  • Disaster_Accident
  • Education
  • Entertainment_Culture
  • Environment
  • Health_Medical_Pharma
  • Hospitality_Recreation
  • Human Interest
  • Labor
  • Law_Crime
  • Other
  • Politics
  • Religion_Belief
  • Social Issues
  • Sports
  • Technology_Internet
  • War_Conflict
  • Weather

Version:
1.0
Author:
Jos√© Parada

Method Detail

classify

public java.lang.String classify(java.lang.String text)
Classifies the topic of a given tweet using the classifier.

Parameters:
text - The text of the tweet we want to classify.
Returns:
A topic from the list in the class description.

trainClassifier

public void trainClassifier()
                     throws java.io.IOException,
                            java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
Trains a classifier from scratch using a training directory with a training sample. This training sample was first used in Analyzing User Modeling on Twitter for Personalized News Recommendations.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
See Also:
Analyzing User Modeling on Twitter for Personalized News Recommendations
